resources.string:
BlabberTabber allows you to record how much time each speaker has spoken in a meeting. It is currently in ALPHA test, and does NOT produce meaningful results.
 
To pause, press "PAUSE", to resume, press "RECORD", and to reset the tally, press "RESET".
 
When the meeting is over, press finish to see the final tally. You will have the option to email or SMS the results.
 
BlabberTabber IS WRONG 100% OF THE TIME. We are working to fix it.
 
Please do not review BlabberTabber at this time. (Unless, of course, you want to give us five stars to encourage us to finish it.)
I understand that BlabberTabber is NOT accurate!

Charlotte Cunningham designed BlabberTabber and also created all graphics.
 
BlabberTabber was written by Brendan Cunnie and Brian Cunnie.
 
Daniel Di Matteo wrote the first android diarization program. His code helped us tremendously, and uses LIUM.
 
LIUM is a Java-based open source toolkit for diarization, written by Sylvain Meignier, Gregor Dupuy, Paul Gay, and others. It uses Sphinx.
 
CMU Sphinx is open source toolkit for speech recognition.
 
Gerald Friedland, Ph.D. and Ekaterina Gonina, Ph.D. advised us and published the research papers which inspired us to write BlabberTabber.
